Type.Name: InvalidCastException
Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents the error that occurs when an explicit conversion (casting operation) fails because the source type cannot be converted to the destination type.

block.para: For information on conversions supported by the system, see the class.
For errors that occur when the destination type can store source type values, but is not large enough to store a specific source value, see exception.

example.para: The following example demonstrates an error that causes a exception.
example.code: Caught: System.InvalidCastException: Specified cast is not valid. at InvalidCastExample.Main()

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Cannot cast from source type to destination type." This message takes into account the current system culture.

MemberSignature.Value: public rtspecialname specialname instance void .ctor(string message)

Docs.param: A that describes the error. The content of is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance using . If is , the property is initialized to the system-supplied message provided by the constructor that takes no arguments. The property is initialized to .

MemberSignature.Value: public rtspecialname specialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException)

Docs.param: A that describes the error. The content of is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
An instance of that is the cause of the current exception. If is non-null, then the current exception was raised in a catch block handling .
